Reviews.Title: “Average”
Reviews.Author: Ashwin C
Reviews.Content: Pros: 1) Great Staff, very friendly and helpful 2) Bang in front of Metro Station - Quai de la Gare 3) Comfy Bed Cons 1) AC is turned off in winter. 2) Wi Fi is spotty and unreliable 3) Bathroom was sort of weirdest I have ever seen 4) Limitied choice of restaurants in the area 5) Expensive buffet breakfast for what is actually worth

Reviews.Title: “Funky in France”
Reviews.Author: tripperhov
Reviews.Content: With Paris reputation of poor hotels at extortionate prices, finding a reliable hotel for a fair price (in terms of Parisian prices) is a challenge. If you stumble across the Mercure Paris Austerlitz you’ve found a real gem. It’s funky, cool, trendy, comfortable, clean, has modern TV, free internet (but unreliable), tea/coffee making facilities and a fridge. Staff were very friendly and helpful. Executive rooms are big for Paris, the standard rooms a good size, with funky designs and very comfortable beds. I’ve stayed at this hotel a couple of times now and would stay again. I’d only hesitate with choosing this hotel again if the Marriott was the same price. Getting to the hotel from Denfert Rocherau or Nation station or on metro line 6 if needed) could not be easier; the metro station is outside the front door. There is a supermarket opposite the hotel for provisions. There are a couple of places to eat at reasonable prices near to the hotel, or a 2 minute metro ride away. Breakfast was ok, continental buffet style of cereals/yoghurts and pastries/breads.

Reviews.Title: “Good service, clean, excellent showers, fairly basic.”
Reviews.Author: GItrip
Reviews.Content: Stayed here as a family in Feb 2012 on our way to a skiing holiday. The accommodation was perfectly adequate for an overnight stay. Three of us shared a room. The pull-out bed was comfortable, although lacking in bed linen when we arrived. The guy on the desk was very helpful sorting it out.

Reviews.Title: “Mercure standard confort room; nice location along Seine river”
Reviews.Author: Roccoandhisbrothers
Reviews.Content: Near to Bibliothèque Nationale de France and from Palais Omnisports di Paris-Bercy (350mt)il Mercure Paris Austerlitzis a great loaction along Sein river with a nice overlooking. Despite it is in the middle of traffic, rooms are quite confortable (low noise) and very well equipped witha modern stuff; free Wi-Fi connection. Breakfast is OK and there are several menu choice. Transportation advantage is in front of subway stop (Quai de la Gare) where you can go to downtown or change with others subways line to reach monuments and historical places. It is located also near to railway station of Gare d'Austerlitz and Gare de Lyon. If you stay in Paris for business or leisure is a value money and nice location to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: DKK031
Reviews.Content: I thought this was a great little hotel. It is located next to the river, the national library and the Omnisport arena. Train station is across the road. Although the rooms are compact, they are very functional. The rooms are modern and, most importantly, clean. I thought the staff were very nice and helpful. Breakfast was good. For sure this is an excellent choice if you are visiting on business, expecially if the office is in the near area. If location is not an issue, then this is a good hotel should the office be in another part of Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for great money!”
Reviews.Author: Andthalatiel99
Reviews.Content: We were very satisfied with the hotel and will definitely stay here again during our next stay in the city of love! Room is very nice, bed was very good, bathroom was fully equipped and very clean. Very quiet as the hotel is not located in the center of the city. Breakfast was very good, allthough not much space in the breakfast room. We went to get our breakfast at 8am, to get there before the rush. Very good restaurant next door (Lily and... ?). Free wifi internet is available. Staff is friendly, but not very up to date for tips and tricks to visit Paris. Security is always present, and luggage is kept locked away after check-out until you leave. Location is at the far outside of the center of Paris (quai de la gare), however, metro connections are very good (on average 10-15minutes from and to center Paris). For us, this was not a problem seen the fact that the room was cheaper than any (so called) 3* hotel next to the Tour Eiffel. Additionally, for those travelling from countries nearby: different underground parking spaces are available. Overall: great value for great money!!

Reviews.Title: “Awkward Luxury”
Reviews.Author: suehung
Reviews.Content: The hotel is top notch. The staff well presented and trained. The room is plush, more TV channels available than most other hotels, the bed super comforable, a fridge if you'd like to store your own snacks and drinks and there are Coffee/Tea utensils in the room too. Wifi Internet available for free with a code. (I forget if there was a computer in the lobby, not sure) Unfortunately, the illusion of luxury is destroyed by its location because it becomes an odyssey to get to and fro the hotel. The metro stop is on a line that requires you to change no matter where you want to go in Paris. The bus routes aren't that helpful either. And there were vagrants outside which took the allure away from the place. I got the room at a great price (some promo) and I would go again but I wouldn't take my friends there as they are not as enamored with Paris as I am and I am pretty sure the negatives would put them off.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Ideal”
Reviews.Author: Coralie76
Reviews.Content: For a weekend away in Paris, this hotel was ideal for us. Right next to the metro stop, but not in the middle of the city, so quieter at night. The room was lovely and spacious, and most of all clean. We didn't need anything over the top as we were out and about in the day time. Check in was great, the staff speak English, so it wasn't a total drama trying to find our room when we are both not fluent French. Breakfast was brilliant, buffet style with a decent choice of hot food, cold cheeses and meats, breads, fruit and pastries. Check out was 11am and the hotel had the facilitiy to hold luggage for guests. We didn't use this, but stioll the option was available. The location was brilliant, right nect to the metro, a restaurant/bar 2 doors down where we ate on the first night, excellent food, even better desserts, try the tiramasu nutella or raspberry!! and good value for money. A chemist round the corner, for when someone forgets their toothbrush!! A really good choice for a weekend break in the city, definately would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: E A
Reviews.Content: Really nice hotel and friendly english-speaking staff. We were in a privilege room which was very neat and bright, did not have breakfast so cant comment about that although it did not look bad from the outside hehe. Metro station is just across the road which is a big plus and there is also a small bakery and a supermarket nearby. The area behind the hotel is not very desirable but did not feel dangerous and we used to come back at midnight. A/c did not work very well but they were actually revamping the system during out time there so probably thats why, but we opened the windows during the night and it was quite chilly so didnt even need a/c! Definitely will use again.

Reviews.Title: “Not a good hotel”
Reviews.Author: piet10
Reviews.Content: This hotel is OK but: - There is a very dangerous area right behind the hotel. I feared for my life - Breakfast is the high calorie bread & pastry deal - It is far outside of Paris, & does not qualify as being in central Paris - The front desk is clueless, with only one English speaker - It is on a main road, and is very noisy - Hugely overpriced at 300 Euros per night. There are better choices

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel - would stay here again”
Reviews.Author: traveler541
Reviews.Content: Just spent 3 nights at this hotel on business trip. The front desk staff were all very friendly and helpful, the rooms were smallish but very clean and comfortable. The beds were extremely comfortable !! The location was fine for business as it was close to my office, but otherwise was a little removed from the action. The neighborhood was mostly ok but pretty dead at night. Although there are 2 restaurants adjacent tot he hotel which were lively. The metro stop was adjacent to the hotel and 2 train stations within 5 - 10 minute walk.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel for a short stay but not outstanding”
Reviews.Author: statetrooper61
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located very close to any kind of public transport, the metro station is right across the street in front of he hotel. Service and reception was very friendly and made me feel welcome. The hotel was currently undergoing construction and refurbishment and I was given a newly renovated room. The room was very nice, maybe a bit too colorful painted. Everything was very clean and the free wifi connection definetely is a plus.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable & clean”
Reviews.Author: ton_amie
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel just before Easter, 2009. Although the hotel seems a bit far from some of the major tourist sites, it is rather easy to hop on the metro and find your way around Paris in no time at all. In fact, this hotel is located across the street from the Seine River on the eastern side of Paris. The metro is across the street from the hotel! There is also a Franprix grocery store across the street. The rooms are clean and the beds/pillows are super comfortable. The breakfast contained breads, ham, cheese, fruit, yogurts, scrambled eggs, and sausage. The Mercure chain is very reliable when it comes to comfortable and clean rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, tidy, spacious and good location”
Reviews.Author: Clement
Reviews.Content: Just stayed there for one night. Clean, tidy and spacious room. It's literally 10 steps from the metro exit, so good for us with a heavy luggage. The metro is up there above the ground, so you just take the escalator down, cross the small street, and you're already at the doorstep. Staff speaks English, and is friendly (unlike those in some other hotels in the Accors chain). Location can't be better as it's on the metro line to Gare Montparnasse, where you could take TGV to Mont St-Michel (10-minute ride to the Station).

Reviews.Title: “Fair deal”
Reviews.Author: wimbrussel
Reviews.Content: This is a standard basic three star property. Clean and simple rooms, internet comes at 20 euros per day. If you need to be in the immediate vicinity of either Bercy or the Library, you can't get much closer than this. The Metro stops in front of the door (the trip to Paris Nord will take you 30 minutes maximum). For hungry souls: the brasserie on the corner next to the hotel (Lili et Marcel) is all a Parisian brasserie should be. For 90 euros per night, this is a fair deal.

Reviews.Title: “Comme ci, Comme ca”
Reviews.Author: DrRuthless
Reviews.Content: With the metro station just outside the door, this hotel was fairly convenient. It did not feel like Paris to us though. It is a bit further southeast from the action. The neighborhood is apparently undergoing renovation, but it felt a little "on edge" to us. Young men were frequently loitering on the side streets. We wanted to us the laundromat, but were afraid! The hotel doors were sometimes locked. There were some good cafes within walking distance, though. The hotel itself, however, was quite nice and the staff very friendly and helpful. The room had all the amenities we needed and was nicely decorated and comfortable. The breakfast was very good. My only complaints was that the air conditioning went out and nobody mentioned it to us. When we asked, we were told it would be up soon. But it took over 24 hours and it was HOT.

HotelInfo.Name: Mercure Paris Austerlitz Bibliotheque
HotelInfo.Address: 6 boulevard Vincent Auriol, 75013 Paris, France
